content.description:
Another Bolt ladder going up the crumbly, overhanging rock. This one however may be the longest one in Echo Park. On the first pitch I believe I counted 22 bolts total. Its a mix of old sleeve bolts, a few bomber fusions and ten or so rivets. The anchor has two good bolts with permanent lockers on them and two older bolts with tat on them. the slings are not to be trusted...    you can increase the fun of this pitch by bringing a hook for some awesome little ledges. 

  second pitch sucks.. don't waste your time. the rivet ladder continues to 5.3 climbing to the top where you'll find a bolted anchor.  

  If you fix a rope on the first pitch, you can do a big and fun swing of the ledge you start on. If you run fast enough you can cannonball into the neighbors pool..
content.protection:
Biners. lots of them and a selection of larger hangers for the rivets. I brought 6 and then started using nuts..        

  also if you are soloing, you'll find a wonderful crack to make an anchor out of off the starting ledge. Takes #3 to yellow alien.
content.location: In the obvious black water streak at the end of the wall.

content.description: Route climbs a cool overhanging stem box/chimney to large ledge. There is a three bolt anchor (no rap hardware) just over lip at the top, as well as a two bolt anchor further back (with rap tat).
content.protection: About half a dozen bolts. First two are kinda old with Leeper hangers, past there they are acceptable looking.
content.location: The only bolted line right of Forrest Roof.

content.description: There is evidence of a route going up a crack system just left of Zinfandel. About one meter left of the start of Zinfandel, a hangerless drop-in marks the start. A thin crack heads up to an old bolt with hanger visible from the ground. Above this, a dirty looking crack goes up then into a shallow dihedral to top of wall.
content.protection: Mud nailing gear, hooks, pro through large hand size
content.location: Immediately to the left of Zinfandel. Route trends left then up.

content.description: A relatively quiet area on Camelback that sees much less traffic than the eastern areas located closer to the parking lot. Feels nice and secluded even though when climbing the routes here you can see into peoples backyard.. They will be lounging in their pool watching you while you bake on the wall while getting eaten by nats.
